component_description: Typography.Title is for rendering headings with different levels of importance, ranging from h1 to h5. It provides semantic HTML structure and consistent styling for titles and headings.

className.name: className
className.description: A space-delimited list of class names to pass along to the element.

intent.name: intent
intent.description: Visual intent color to apply to text.

level.name: level
level.description: The level of Title including 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5 which are equivalent to h1, h2, h3, h4 and h5.

style.name: style
style.description: Additional inline style to be applied for the most outer element of the component.

examples.example_name: Typography.Title with different levels and intents
examples.example_description:
There are 5 levels of a Title: - **1** (for h1) - **2** (for h2) - **3** (for h3) - **4** (for h4) - **5** (for h5) It is set to `1` by default. ```jsx live <> Employment Hero. Bring all your HR into one, easy-to-use place.
HR Software. Speedy onboarding and compliant contracts. Simplify HR tasks with real-time updates. Easily manage employee records and performance reviews.
Digital Payroll. Automatic award interpretation and dynamic rostering. Ensure accurate payments effortlessly. Stay compliant with the latest payroll regulations.
Employee Engagement. Communicate and engage with your team. Boost workplace culture with regular feedback. Encourage collaboration through interactive platforms.
Employee Benefits. Discounts, wellness programs & much more. Increase satisfaction with various perks. Support your team's well-being with tailored benefits.
Global Teams. Engage the best talent, anywhere in the world. Manage international staff seamlessly. Facilitate smooth cross-border operations and compliance. ```
examples.code:
<> Employment Hero. Bring all your HR into one, easy-to-use place.
HR Software. Speedy onboarding and compliant contracts. Simplify HR tasks with real-time updates. Easily manage employee records and performance reviews.

Global Teams. Engage the best talent, anywhere in the world. Manage international staff seamlessly. Facilitate smooth cross-border operations and compliance.
examples.purpose_description: The Typography.Title component is designed to render headings with different levels of importance, ranging from h1 to h5. This example demonstrates how to use the component to create a structured and visually distinct hierarchy of titles, which is essential for organizing content in a clear and accessible manner while maintaining consistent styling across different sections of an application.
examples.technical_description: The example uses the Typography.Title component to render headings with varying levels of importance. The 'level' prop determines the semantic HTML tag (h1 through h5) that is used, which affects both the visual styling and the document structure for accessibility. The 'intent' prop is used to apply different styles to the text, such as 'subdued', 'primary', or 'white', allowing for visual differentiation based on context or importance. The example also uses the Box component to apply background styles, demonstrating how to combine typography with layout components for enhanced presentation.
examples.patterns_description: This example demonstrates the use of component composition, where Typography.Title is used alongside Box to create a cohesive layout. It shows the use of props for styling and semantic HTML, which is a best practice for accessibility and SEO. The use of the 'intent' prop for styling is a pattern that allows for consistent theming and styling across the application. Additionally, the use of React fragments (<>...</>) helps in grouping multiple elements without adding extra nodes to the DOM.
examples.use_cases_description: This example is particularly useful in scenarios where a clear and structured presentation of content is required, such as in documentation, marketing pages, dashboards, or landing pages. It can be used in any application that requires a consistent and accessible way to display headings and subheadings, ensuring that users can easily navigate and understand the content hierarchy. The ability to style titles differently based on intent also makes it suitable for applications that need to highlight or differentiate certain sections of text based on context or importance.
